text: Oh, definitely it has. Although I think
that's the quite a little bit the wrong
way of putting it because it is also the
integration of westerners into eastern
thought you know into the eastern way of
life actually. You know, the western way
of life has been revealed to anybody
with eyes to be self-destructive
actually, which means it isn't actually
intrinsically the western way of life.
We have Plato. We have Socrates who
advocated a vegetarian diet and not
eating meat and so on. Back in the
republic, he advocated that and he said
if you eat too much meat, people will be
sick and you'll have to have a lot of
doctors. He did 2500 years ago. I was so
amazed. And now you know so in in Asia
they didn't try to eat 30% protein and
get cancer and all these diseases of our
diet and our way of living and polluting
our environment.
Industrialization is not actually a
genius invention. It is
self-destructive. It's like cancer
actually on the planet planetary cancer
because what is cancer is is random
growth of cells healthy strong growth
without regard to the host where it's
growing. So it then becomes
self-destructive. And industrialization
is a big growth destroying the host
which is the planet. And economics is a
demented science. It's not just dismal,
it's demented because the resources are
free and the waste pollution, you know,
the waste disposal is free. And then
it's just how much money you make in
there is your domestic product and your
whatever. And that's silly because
obviously the resources have a cost,
tremendous cost. And the and the waste
disposal has a huge cost too. And that
has to be factored in. And if it was,
there would be very different
decision-making in our
industrialization. So we have to get
into a more holistic, more enlightened
vision. Asia was thousands of years
ahead of us with nonviolence. Jesus was
teaching us. But nobody and many rabbis,
other rabbis than Jesus, but nobody was
listening, particularly the Roman
emperors were not listening. And so but
the Asian people, the rulers did more
listen to the Buddhas and the Lasus and
the Confuciouses. And so they were much
more into nonviolence much longer and
therefore they prospered and thrived and
Columbus was trying to get to India
because they were more prosperous 500
years ago. So we have to realize that
we're not actually the center of the
universe. The Mediterranean is not the
center. It's peripheral. And we have to
learn to live more in harmony with
nature. Men have to live more in harmony
with women and uh and stop driving
around in their tanks. You know, it's
just useless. And uh and that's what and
that's you know we're making progress
but the rear guard action you know you
know Michael Dukakus in the tank and
Dick Cheney has tried his wheelchair his

We have to we have to overcome that
